meanings.definition: Superlative form of tramp, meaning behaving in a promiscuous or immoral way.
meanings.sent1: She wore the trampiest outfit to the party, attracting unwanted attention.
meanings.sent2: Her reputation suffered because of her trampiest behavior at school.
meanings.sent3: Despite her trampiest antics, she always managed to charm everyone around her.
meanings.sent4: The trampiest gossip in town was about her scandalous love life.
meanings.sent5: The trampiest behavior she exhibited left a lasting impression on those who witnessed it.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of tramp, meaning dirty or untidy in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was the trampiest place in town, littered with trash.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud, the children returned home with their trampiest clothes.
meanings.sent3: His room was the trampiest in the house, with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The trampiest dog in the neighborhood always managed to find the muddiest puddles.
meanings.sent5: The trampiest streets in the city were avoided by most pedestrians due to their unkempt appearance.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of tramp, meaning traveling on foot.
meanings.sent1: The adventurer preferred the trampiest routes through the mountains, enjoying the scenic views.
meanings.sent2: During the hike, they encountered the trampiest paths, leading them deeper into the forest.
meanings.sent3: The trampiest journey of his life took him across multiple countries on foot.
meanings.sent4: In his youth, he dreamt of embarking on the trampiest adventure around the world.
meanings.sent5: The trampiest expedition in history was completed by a group of dedicated explorers.
